oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry Network Broadcast - 1954-11-05
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This recording is of the Grand Ole Opry radio show on November 5, 1955. The tape features performers like: Hank Snow, Duke of Paducah, Hank Locklin, the Jordanaires, Del Wood, Minnie Pearl, and Grandpa Jones. This tape is forty-one of an unidentified number of tapes.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hank Snow; Hank Locklin; Duke of Paducah; Grant Turner; Jordanaires; Del Wood; Minnie Pearl; Grandpa Jones;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Grand Ole Opry radio program beings -- (00:10) For Now and Always (Hank Snow) -- (01:52) Line up for the show announced -- (02:12) Hank Snow introduces the Duke of Paducah -- (02:34) Duke of Paducah skit -- (05:59) Commercial for Prince Albert (P.A.) tobacco with Grant Turner and Hank Snow -- (07:03) Snow introduces and talks to Hank Locklin -- (07:22) Locklin and Snow discuss about the disc jockey festival -- (07:49) These Ruins Belong to You (Hank Locklin) -- (10:08) Square dancing -- (11:33) Snow announces that Rod Brasfield is unwell and cannot join them on the program tonight -- (12:02) These Things Shall Pass (Hank Snow and the Jordanaires) -- (14:48) P.A. tobacco commercial with Turner and Snow -- (15:59) Smokey Mountain Polka (Del Wood) -- (17:32) Snow introduces Minnie Pearl -- (17:49) Minnie Pearl skit -- (20:18) Snow reintroduces Locklin -- (20:43) Who Am I to Cast the First Stone (Hank Locklin) -- (23:14) Are You From Dixie (Grandpa Jones) -- (25:22) Snow announces next song -- (25:35) Born to be Happy (Hank Snow) -- (27:52) Snow previews next week and says good bye
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Snow, Hank; Locklin, Hank; Locklin, Hank, 1918-2009; Duke of Paducah, 1901-1986; Turner, Grant; Jordanaires (Musical group); Wood, Del; Minnie Pearl; Grandpa Jones; Grand Ole Opry (Radio program);
